The easiest way to get started with ValidMind is to try out our {{< var vm_dev >}} in Jupyter Hub and to explore the {{< var vm_platform >}} online. 

## Before you begin

To try out ValidMind, you need to be a registered user on the {{< var vm_platform >}}.

::: {.callout-tip}
### Need an account for ValidMind? 
Signing up is FREE â€” **[Create your account]({{< var vm_url >}})**.
:::

### {{< var vm_framework >}}

To try the {{< var vm_framework >}}, you need access to ONE of the following:

- [Jupyter Hub](quickstart-try-developer-framework-with-jupyterhub.qmd) (recommended)
- [Google Colaboratory](quickstart-try-developer-framework-with-colab.qmd)
- [Local developer environment](quickstart-try-developer-framework-in-your-own-developer-environment.qmd)

### {{< var vm_platform >}}

We support most modern browsers, such as Microsoft Edge, Google Chrome, Apple Safari, or Mozilla Firefox.

To upload from the {{< var vm_dev >}} to the {{< var vm_ui >}} and to access the web user interface, you must be able to access our domains:

- validmind.ai
- validmind.com

If necessary, ask a network administrator to add these domains to your firewall allowlist (whitelist). 

If your company has strict security requirements and requires you to connect via VPN or AWS PrivateLink, please contact your IT/InfoSec team. For additional help setting up a VPN or PrivateLink with the {{< var vm_risk >}} please visit [configure AWS PrivateLink](configure-aws-privatelink.qmd) or send an email to <support@validmind.ai>.

## Steps

1. [Try the {{< var vm_framework >}} with Jupyter Hub (recommended)](quickstart-try-developer-framework-with-jupyterhub.qmd) (15 minutes)

   Try our introductory Jupyter notebook to see the {{< var vm_dev >}} in action. 

2. Explore the {{< var vm_platform >}} (15 minutes):

    - [Explore sample model documentation](quickstart-explore-sample-model-documentation.qmd)
    - [Register your first model](quickstart-register-your-first-model.qmd)
    - [Generate documentation for your model](quickstart-generate-documentation-for-your-model.qmd)

### What's next

If you're ready to do more with ValidMind, check out [Next steps](next-steps.qmd).
